com.zberman2.DataManager

Class Board

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.zberman2.DataManager.Board

  • public class Board
extends java.lang.Object
    Class describing the functionality of a chess board Created by Zack Berman on 9/10/2014.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Board()
      Blank constructor
      Board(java.util.ArrayList<Piece> pieces)
      Constructor which accepts an ArrayList of pieces

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Piece at(char x, int y)
      Method which iterates through the list of pieces and determines if there is a piece at (x, y) on the board.
      int getNumSides()
      Getter for number of sides of the board (not used, but may be useful if game is changed from a standard square board to something else)

      Getter for pieces

      Getter for x dimension of the board

      Prints terminal window chess board

        public Board()
        Blank constructor

      • Board

        public Board(java.util.ArrayList<Piece> pieces)
        Constructor which accepts an ArrayList of pieces
        Parameters:
        pieces - ArrayList of initial chess pieces to be placed on the board

    • Method Detail

      • setPieces

        public void setPieces(java.util.ArrayList<Piece> pieces)
        Setter for the ArrayList of pieces. Used with the blank constructor to construct a blank board, and later add the pieces.
        Parameters:
        pieces - ArrayList of initial chess pieces to be placed on the board

      • getPieces

        public java.util.ArrayList<Piece> getPieces()
        Getter for pieces
        Returns:
        ArrayList of pieces on the board

      • getyDimension

        public int getyDimension()
        Getter for y dimension of the board
        Returns:
        yDimension

      • getxDimension

        public int getxDimension()
        Getter for x dimension of the board
        Returns:
        xDimension

      • getNumSides

        public int getNumSides()
        Getter for number of sides of the board (not used, but may be useful if game is changed from a standard square board to something else)
        Returns:
        number of sides on the chess board

      • at

        public Piece at(char x,
                int y)
        Method which iterates through the list of pieces and determines if there is a piece at (x, y) on the board. If there is, it returns that piece, null otherwise.
        Parameters:
        x - x coordinate
        y - y coordinate
        Returns:
        The piece at (x, y), null if one doesn't exist

      • printBoard

        public void printBoard()
        Prints terminal window chess board
